info.description: Welcome to Xfers' API documentation. You can find information on our API endpoint specific to your country.
info.title: Xfers API

contact.name: Contact us through our help desk

post.description:
This API is used to start user registration by inputting phone number.
After this API is called, an OTP SMS will be sent to that number.

You can re-trigger this API again to re-send OTP to the same phone number after 1 minute.

This OTP will expire in 10 minutes.
The SMS format will be:
```
[XFERS] Your OTP is 123456. This is to set up payments for `merchant_name` . If this is not done by you, please report to http://bit.ly/XfersSupport
```
This API uses a pair of public key and secret key.
The header of this API uses public key called `X-XFERS-APP-API-KEY`.
You will need `X-XFERS-APP-SECRET-KEY`  to generate signature in the request body.

requestBody.description: Request Body. Click on Schema for information on the parameters.

phone_no.description: User mobile no. It should follow International format.

signature.description: SHA1-hex of (phone_no + X-XFERS-APP_SECRET_KEY). Generate SH1 key using ...

post.description:
This API is used to start private ledger registration by inputting phone number.

 This API uses a pair of public key and secret key.

The header of this API uses public key called `X-XFERS-APP-API-KEY`. You will need `X-XFERS-APP-SECRET-KEY` to generate signature in the request body.

Please make use of Pre-request Script to test this API in postman

requestBody.description: Request Body. Click on Schema for information on the parameters.

phone_no.description: User mobile no. It should follow International format.

signature.description: SHA1-hex of (phone_no + X-XFERS-APP_SECRET_KEY). Generate SH1 key using ...

value.error_handling: Make sure you entered the correct parameters.

get.summary: Get User API Token / Submit OTP
get.description:
After user receives the OTP SMS, merchant's app should capture the OTP and pass it to Xfers via this API.
This API will finish the registration and returns user_api_token. user_api_token is used to control the user's account.
You should save the user_api_token for future usage. (to be put in the `X-XFERS-USER-API-KEY` in headers of other APIs)

It will also return a is_fully_verified if they already have an Xfers account and have completed our KYC process.

This API uses a pair of public key and secret key.
The header of this API uses public key called `X-XFERS-APP-API-KEY`. You will need `X-XFERS-APP-SECRET-KEY` to generate signature in the request body.

parameters.name: otp
parameters.description: User mobile no. It should follow International format.

parameters.name: phone_no
parameters.description: User mobile no. It should follow International format.

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: SHA1-hex of (phone_no + OTP + X-XFERS-APP_SECRET_KEY). Generate SH1 key using ...

parameters.name: return_url
parameters.description: Url that new user will be redirected after they completed Xfers account registration at `sign_up_url` provided.

put.description:
To provide KYC data in order to change user from unverified status into fully verified status.  

The image/document provided us must be hosted in an URL then pass the URL to Xfers via this API.  
Make sure data type for your image is jpeg / png.  
Maximum size of the image/ document is 10 MB.  

After this data is sent, we will do some verifications on our side and may take some time before user gets fully verified.  In Indonesia, fully verified user will be backed by a savings account.
Thus, there are required parameters which are mother_maiden_name, id_front_url, selfie_2id_url.
Additional data will speed up the KYC process.

requestBody.description: Request Body. Click on Schema for information on the parameters.

id_front_url.description: URL storing the front image of user identity card

selfie_2id_url.description: URL storing the selfie of user holding their id card

mother_maiden_name.description: Required for Indo, Optional for SG. Name of Mother

date_of_birth.description: Date of birth for account holder in yyyy-mm-dd

identity_no.description: Account holder national identity number or, KTP number of Indonesian.

annual_income.description: Annual income of user in the local currency (SGD/IDR)

id_back_url.description: URL storing the back of the user id card

proof_of_address_url.description: URL storing the proof of address

meta_data.description: Addtional data like Jumio info dump.

blood_type.description: Account holder’s blood type, without rhesus. Possible values: ‘A’, ‘B’, 'AB’, or 'O’

rt.description: Only Indonesia. Account holder’s RT according to his/her KTP. Leading zero is optional.

rw.description: Account holder’s RW according to his/her KTP. Leading zero is optional.

administrative_village.description: Account holder’s administrative_village address. In KTP, it is called Kelurahan or Desa.

state.description: Account holder’s state of residence. In KTP, it is called Provinsi.

district.description: Only Indonesia. Account holder’s district address. In KTP, it is called Kecamatan.

religion.description: Only Indonesia. Account holder’s religion according to his/her KTP. Possible Values: 'Islam’, 'Katholik’, 'Kristen Protestan’, 'Hindu’, 'Budha’, 'Kong Hu Cu’, or 'Aliran Kepercayaan’

marital_status.description: Only Indonesia. Account holder’s marital status according to his/her KTP. Possible Values: 'Belum Kawin’, 'Kawin’, 'Janda’, or 'Duda’

occupation.description: Only Indonesia. Account holder’s occupation according to his/her KTP.

callback_url.description: URL to receive callback notifications on account verification changes. This parameter is still supported but is going through deprecation. We strongly advice you to use the dashboard to set callback_url instead.

get.description:
The main usage of this API is to get the current user’s balance to be displayed to user when he checks his account. 
You can also use this API to check various data of the user such as first_name, last_name.
Description of some notable response.

post.description: This is Xfers' callback request to notify KYC status

servers.description: This is your endpoint you set in the dashboard or notify_url

id.description: A unique ID for the user

reason.description: reason for verification status. Only applicable when verification_status is false

200.description: Your server returns this code if it accepts the callback

get.description:
This API displays a user’s transaction history. 


This API displays a user’s transaction history.

I.e. user’s transactions with other merchants will not be displayed.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Earliest date to query

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Latest date to query

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset results for pagination purposes.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Will only show transactions of that type. You can add additional types by separating with a comma.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Will only show transactions of that status. You can add additional types by separating with a comma. Note that putting “completed” will also return transactions with “paid” - you can take them to be the same.

get.summary: Get Transfer Info / Get Virtual Account Number
get.description:
API to get bank account number to be shown to user.
Please consult with us to get topup instruction template text to be shown.
The common usage of this API is to parse the transfer_info_array given by us and parse it and use the VA numbers of the bank you want.
For Virtual Account solution:
This API is to get the Virtual Account Number to be displayed to the user
For non Virtual Account solution:
This API will show the bank account number to do top up.
Please consult with us as this solution will require user to use some other identifier to detect the deposit.

x-code-samples.source:
curl --location --request POST "{{base-api-url}}api/v3/charges" \
  --header "X-XFERS-USER-API-KEY: {{user-api-key}}" \
  --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
  --form "amount=10000" \
  --form "user_api_token={{user-api-token}}" \
  --form "order_id=Order_docs_12345" \
  --form "description=Testing for Documentation" \
  --form "notify_url=https://www.example.com/updates" \
  --form "meta_data=test metadata"

post.description:
The following API will allow you to move money from user's account to merchant's account.
In header X-XFERS-USER-API-KEY, You need to put merchant's api key. (As found in Dashboard > Settings > API Tokens).
In the user_api_token in the body, You need to put user's api key. (As received from get_user_token API).

requestBody.description: Request Body. Click on Schema for information on the parameters.

user_api_token.description: This is your user's api token. You can retrieve this from the Get Token API.

order_id.description: Unique ref no provided by you to prevent double charging, this cannot be repeated.

notify_url.description: URL to receive callback notifications on charge success/failure. This parameter is still supported but is going through deprecation. We strongly advice you to use the dashboard to set notify_url instead.

meta_data.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a charge. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format.

get.description:
Retrieves the details of a charge that has previously been created.
Supply the ID that was returned from your previous request, and Xfers will return the corresponding charge information.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Charge ID that could be retrieved from the response in Create Charge endpoint

value.error_handling: Make sure you entered the correct parameters.
Make sure you entered the correct parameters.

post.description:
This API will refund a charge.
Both funds and fees in this transaction will be refunded to the user's Xfers account.
Please use the merchant’s API key for this endpoint

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Charge ID that could be retrieved from the response in Create Charge endpoint

post.description:
The following API will allow you to move money from merchant's account to user's account.
In header X-XFERS-USER-API-KEY, You need to put merchant's api key. (As found in Dashboard > Settings > API Tokens).
In the user_api_token in the body, You need to put user's api key. (As received from get_user_token API).
Alternatively, You can also make a peer to peer transfer using this API by putting the sender's token in X-XFERS-USER-API-KEY in the header and putting the receiver's token in user_api_token in the body

requestBody.description: Request Body. Click on Schema for information on the parameters.

user_api_token.description: Your user API token which you can retrieve this from the get token API response

invoice_id.description: Unique ref no provided by you to prevent double charging, this cannot be repeated.

description.description: Description of transaction for display purposes

get.description:
Retrieves the details of a payout that has previously been created.
Supply the unique payout ID that was returned from your previous request, and Xfers will return the corresponding payout information.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Payout ID. You can get this from the create payout API.

post.description:
This API will be used to attach a new bank account to a user.
You will be able to withdraw user's balance to this bank account.
In Indonesia Production, This API will return the detected_name as provided from the bank.
The account_holder_name you provided and detected_name needs to be similar (doesn't need to be 100% match).

requestBody.description: Request Body. Click on Schema for information on the parameters.

bank.description: Bank abbreviation. You can get the list of bank account abbreviation from the Get Bank and Abbreviation Mapping API.

account_holder_name.description: Name of bank account holder name. Put 'PROD_ONLY' in Indo Sandbox

get.description: This will list all bank accounts belonging to the user.

put.description: This request allows you to update an existing bank account record.

parameters.name: bank_account_id
parameters.description: The ID of the bank account. You can retrieve this from in the response of Create Bank Account and List Bank Account API

requestBody.description: Request Body. Click on Schema for information on the parameters.

bank.description: Bank abbreviation. You can get the list of bank account abbreviation from the Get Bank and Abbreviation Mapping API.

account_holder_name.description: Name of bank account holder name. Put 'PROD_ONLY' in Indo Sandbox

delete.description: This request allows you to delete an existing bank account record.

parameters.name: bank_account_id
parameters.description: The ID of the bank account. You can retrieve this from in the response of Create Bank Account and List Bank Account API

post.description:
Withdrawal Time varies upon country. For Indonesia, withdrawal time is instantenous. For Singapore, withdrawal time depends on whether it is an express withdrawal.
Withdrawal on Behalf
If you wish to withdraw to a bank account not belonging to you, add in user_api_token in the params.
Behind the scenes, Xfers does a payout of funds from your Xfers account to that user’s Xfers account, followed by a withdrawal. This is required for compliance purposes as we cannot directly withdraw funds to a bank account not belonging to you.

parameters.name: bank_account_id
parameters.description: The ID of the bank account. You can retrieve this from in the response of Create Bank Account and List Bank Account API

requestBody.description: Request Body. Click on Schema for information on the parameters.

idempotency_id.description: Unique ref no provided by you to prevent double transaction, this cannot be repeated, Currently only activated for Indonesia

express.description:
Only Singapore. Currently only used for Singapore.
Express Withdrawal has fees but will arrive at recipient bank within 24 hrs.
Standard withdrawal is free but takes 2-3 business day to arrive at recipient bank.
Defaults to false

user_api_token.description: Use this param if you want to withdraw to another user’s bank account instead of your own.

get.description:
This API will be used to get the current status of withdrawal request.
It is useful if you want to check with Xfers again about the status of your withdrawal request in case there is something wrong with the callback of the withdrawal request status.

parameters.name: withdrawal_request_id
parameters.description: The ID of the withdrawal you want to get information of. You can retrieve this information from the

get.description: This API will be used to get a list of the last 10 withdrawal requests.

post.description:
To close a Xfers-Sobatku Account.
The account needs to fulfill the following conditions:
Fully Verified
Contain no balance
Does not have any pending contracts (transaction)
Please note:
Closing a user’s Xfers-Sobatku account will lower the account limit for this user to a Guest Account Limit of IDR 2.000.000,00
However, user will still be a verified user
To reopen the user’s account, please contact support at http://bit.ly/xferssupport

To close a Xfers-Sobatku Account.
The account needs to fulfill the following conditions:
Fully Verified
Contain no balance
Does not have any pending contracts (transaction)
Please note:
Closing a user’s Xfers-Sobatku account will lower the account limit for this user to a Guest Account Limit of IDR 2.000.000,00
However, user will still be a verified user
To reopen the user’s account, please contact support at http://bit.ly/xferssupport
Creating a Loan. We will pass this loan asynchronously and give callback after complete.

requestBody.description: Request Body. Click on Schema for information on the parameters.

get.description:
Get the Detail of a Loan Request Given The id of a its loan.
Available Status:
created -> after customer just created the loan to us
loan_request_processing -> after we called sampoerna loan API and no callback yet
loan_request_approved -> after we just received sampoerna callback and it is approved
loan_request_rejected -> after we just received sampoerna callback and it is rejected
withdrawal_on_behalf_processing -> after they call our WOB API, WOB still in pending state
withdrawal_on_behalf_completed -> after they call our WOB API, WOB still in completed state
withdrawal_on_behalf_failed -> after they call our WOB API, WOB in bank_rejected, they need to retry or this is final state
disbursement_report_processing -> after customer call our disbursement report API
disbursement_report_completed -> after we just call sampoerna disbursement API and completed
disbursement_report_failed-> after we just call sampoerna disbursement API and failed

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Loan ID. You can find this from the response when you create loan.

post.description: Get Outstanding Loans. Response of this reconciliation request will be in callback.

requestBody.description: Request Body. Click on Schema for information on the parameters.

page.description: The page number of loan_reconciliation. Starts with 1. Automatically set to 1 if this is not present while per_page is present.

per_page.description: The amount of outstanding loans per page. If this is null or not present, will returns all outstanding loans.

from.description: Starting Date of the recon time.

to.description: Ending Date of the recon time.

requestBody.description: Request Body. Click on Schema for information on the parameters.

page.description: The page number of loan_reconciliation. Starts with 1. Automatically set to 1 if this is not present while per_page is present.

per_page.description: The amount of outstanding loans per page. If this is null or not present, will returns all outstanding loans.

post.description:
Note: Disbursement and Withdrawal will be used synonymously. Disbursement is instantenous.
Disbursement (Withdrawal on Behalf)
If you wish to disburse to a bank account not belonging to you, add in user_api_token in the params.
Disbursement (a.k.a Withdrawal) notification
After you setup your callback url in {{base-api-url}}/merchant_settings/callback_settings, we will send you the callback with the following parameter when the withdrawal is completed or failed. You need to acknowledge the callback by responding with a HTTP 200 status when succesfully processed.
We will send completed callback after we have confirmed with the bank that the money has been sent.

parameters.name: loan_id
parameters.description: Loan ID. You can find this from the response when you create loan.

requestBody.description: Request Body. Click on Schema for information on the parameters.

idempotency_id.description: Unique ref no provided by you to prevent double transaction, this cannot be repeated, Currently only activated for Indonesia.

user_api_token.description: Use this param if you want to withdraw to another user’s bank account instead of your own. This is your user API token which you can retrieve from the get token API response

get.description: This API will be used to get a list of the last 10 withdrawal requests associated with the loan

parameters.name: loan_id
parameters.description: Loan ID. You can find this from the response when you create loan.

get.description: This API is used to get the current status of the loan disbursement (in the form of a withdrawal contract), in case the callback of the disbursement status is unclear.

parameters.name: loan_id
parameters.description: Loan ID. You can find this from the response when you create loan.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Disbursement ID. You can find this from the response when you create loan.

get.description: This will provide you with a list of banks we support. Usually used for Add Bank Account API
Get a mock OTP. This is only usable in sandbox environment

parameters.name: phone_no
parameters.description: Phone Number. For international number, you can use ’%2B’ to replace the plus(’+’) sign. (i.e. use %2B6287785725657 instead of +6287785725657)

put.description: You need to wait for a few seconds after withdrawal creation to run this API. Currently only available in Indonesia

requestBody.description: Request Body. Click on Schema for information on the parameters.

idempotency_id.description: Idempotency ID you use to create your withdrawal request
